text: Third Congressional District candidate @DeanBPhillips and I took an amusing break from...well...everything...and drove his government repair truck around Plymouth where I grew up.  Check out Constituents in Trucks Getting Coffee! Go Dean! https://t.co/prpx1rTRAg
Sunny start to our day, kicking off the @MinnesotaDFL bus tour with @tinasmithmn @tim_walz @peggyflanagan @renamoran @melvincarter3 @Jacob_Frey and a big, fired up crowd! https://t.co/DCxYXsTR3O

Thanks to the Winona Daily News for the thoughtful endorsement.  This election is really important to the future of Winona...workforce solutions, farm bill, infrastructure investment. Thanks. U.S. Senate: Amy Klobuchar https://t.co/FKNggPRmmb via @winonadailynews

An energetic start to the AM in West St Paul with lots of volunteers & this amazing organizer, Sarah Gooderham! She’s so proud of the volunteers, the candidates she is helping, and the work they are all doing — its her smile I will remember on election night when Democrats win! https://t.co/DrrsRWFr5o

.@Oprah’s call to action about the right to vote and honoring those who sacrificed to ensure that everyone has a voice in our democracy is a message all should hear. “Every single one of us has the same power at the polls.” https://t.co/Oo4bFHg6su

.@TinaSmithMN did a great job in her debate last night.  She continues to work hard and stand up for what’s right and I’m proud to have her as a colleague. 
https://t.co/BC181UXL8d

Why do the costs of prescription drugs continue to skyrocket? There’s only one answer to that: the big pharmaceutical companies own Washington. Well, they don’t own us. Together, we will take them on. https://t.co/Z1vJJYDxHD

It’s the girls on the bus-a great crew of women traveling the state today in support of all our candidates! Glad to be with @peggyflanagan @julieblaha & @melissahortman (also pictured on our bus: @tinasmithmn!) loved our visits to West St Paul, U of M, Brooklyn Park & St Cloud. https://t.co/tY9fXwg3F3
The bus tour stopped at the U of M this afternoon.  It reminded me of campaigning there with @algore during my first campaign - #fbf to 2006! https://t.co/UXe10IXqHN
And good to meet Grandma Hilda!  Hey, that’s me on that bus! https://t.co/QvEOtnR9tu

Want to know a great way to start your morning? Firing up our amazing volunteers with this great crew of women. Thanks to everyone that joined @TinaSmithMN, @VoteBetty, @renamoran, @TristaMatas & me in St. Paul. Let's get out the vote and get this done! https://t.co/1zh7F0j9XQ

Thank you to the Fargo Forum newspapers and the @duluthnewstribune for the endorsements, and for highlighting some of the important work we’ve done for the region - from workforce development to expanding broadband to Great Lakes Restoration.
https://t.co/uZsMkDtAmd
What a crowd in Northfield!! I've never seen energy quite like this. Great to be on Carleton College's campus with our next Congresswoman, @AngieCraigMN! https://t.co/w9zJxOe6S8

Every year, I visit all 87 counties. I go to work every day with just one goal in mind: getting the job done for Minnesotans. Please share this final message with your friends, and make sure they get out to vote on November 6... And I’ll see you soon! https://t.co/cksMqeZ1pu

Thanks to the Fairmont Sentinel for the endorsement.  I will continue to be a voice for rural areas, farmers, and all Minnesotans in the Senate.  @TheSentinelMN
https://t.co/3TDGRGmOmM

Another great kick off today in North Minneapolis with @TinaSmithMN, @peggyflanagan, and @IlhanMN!  We have two days to talk to as many people as we can about this election. Let’s get out there and get people to the polls! https://t.co/rZ2RPzBVQS
With just 2 days until Election Day it’s all hands on deck — which includes my husband! Thanks for rallying volunteers in Apple Valley and Eden Prairie, John! https://t.co/Pp7eUIRjnR

A ⁦@Vikings great no longer with us..When I was growing up I got to go to games w/my dad. I’d stand outside of the locker room waiting for him to finish his interviews and I got to meet Boom Boom Brown...from⁩ Ex-Vikings Bill 'Boom Boom' Brown dies. https://t.co/1WifYEIJ8q

Thanks to ECM Newspapers and your 49 publications across Minnesota for the endorsement. Local papers like yours are so important to covering the news in our state and in the country. 
https://t.co/yDvT0jQ3ju

Good to be with members of our Somali community this weekend at the Karmel Mall.  The Mall is always buzzing with activity, and I enjoyed meeting so many shop owners, customers, and community leaders. https://t.co/o1A0zrl7ng

This weekend I completed my annual tradition of visiting all 87 MN counties. This year's final stop was Goodhue Co. where I visited @RedWingIgnite's new makerspace at @MSCSoutheast. Traveling around our state & listening to Minnesotans is the best part of being your Senator. https://t.co/IXVwdTheUU

A message to voters in Minnesota’s Second District - that means you Shakopee, Burnsville, Cottage Grove, Eagan, Northfield, Red Wing and everything in between: Vote for @AngieCraigMN. I want to work with Angie, someone who will always have your back! https://t.co/qcnXnthfVh

Memo to voters in Minnesota’s First District (that means you Mankato, Rochester, Albert Lea, Austin, and all the great places in Southern MN): Vote for @DanielFeehan. I want someone I can work with that’s there for you. https://t.co/CSAyftzyfy

Voters in Minnesota’s 3rd District -that means you Brooklyn Park, Plymouth, Champlin, Bloomington, Maple Plain, & all the great cities & towns in between: Tomorrow is the day to get out & vote for @DeanBPhillips -I'm ready to work with Dean, who I know will always put MN first! https://t.co/VV0yj4h04Z

John & I voted early today and then campaigned downtown and in the skyways, as is my tradition!  Be sure to make your plan to vote - you can early vote today until 5:00pm, or vote tomorrow on Election Day, polling places across MN will be open from 7:00am - 8:00pm. https://t.co/I6uPouUB6S

Attention voters in the mighty 8th: There’s an important choice in this election, and I urge you to vote for @JoeRadinovich. He’s the partner I want in Congress, who will always stand up for hard work, fair play, and the people of the 8th! https://t.co/o2rNoW73LL
Lots and lots of people here with us in St. Paul tonight for Midnight Madness! Neither rain nor sleet nor snow will stop democracy now.  VOTE! https://t.co/PXln5xkdJb
Good to be on @colbertlateshow tonight making the closing argument on why everyone needs to vote tomorrow! https://t.co/jCi3BcNodo
Finally! Election Day is here and in a testament to this historic day I even changed out my photos on Twitter!  It’s a day of new beginnings! https://t.co/qpVX1fnxhg

There’s a lot to vote for today Minnesota..but don’t forget to flip the ballot & vote for 2 great judges (you will find them in a sea of judges on the back): Margaret Chutich and Lucinda Jesson. To help you remember, here is a great pic of a family of Jesson supporters up north: https://t.co/G6GOwHIZTz

I appreciate the endorsement of newspapers across our state, including the @StarTribune. This election is like no other - be a part of it!  Go out and vote! 
https://t.co/V2zMEw4luJ
...and you don’t even need a babysitter to go vote! Thanks to @floresliz12 of the @StarTribune for this photo of democracy in action. https://t.co/ELuaI2TFwD

Throughout this campaign, @Tim_Walz and @PeggyFlanagan have focused on #OneMinnesota - the issues that unite instead of divide; that lift people up instead of tear them down. That’s the leadership we need in the Governor’s Office. Vote Walz/Flanagan!

My friend @TinaSmithMN has always been known as someone who listens, finds common ground, and gets things done. That’s the kind of partner I need in the Senate. Today, I hope you’ll cast your vote to re-elect Tina Smith!
https://t.co/fie5uKmgvS
Four hours to go!  Vote for @TinaSmithMN @Tim_Walz @peggyflanagan @MNSteveSimon @keithellison @julieblaha and local officials and congressional candidates who stand for #OneMinnesota

Talked about everything on @colbertlateshow: from the # of Dem lawn signs (it’s like a yard sale in MN!) to significance of the day: today America moves beyond being a mere audience to the blistering White House politics. Today we act as citizens. Vote! 
https://t.co/OkO9s1aiIs
This is why I want to fix our election laws. https://t.co/F3oxqbOysu

The ballot was more than just a ballot this election: Big choices and bigger ideals. Minnesotans voted our dreams, not our fears. We voted for what politics can be—should be—and with your help, will be. I am honored and humbled to continue serving as your US Senator. Thank you! https://t.co/yY5QvKVRTd

I am so proud of my friend and partner in the Senate, @TinaSmithMN. She has said from the beginning of this campaign, “don’t underestimate me” and tonight she has again proved that she will do what it takes to get the job done for Minnesotans. YOU make us all better. https://t.co/eRC3pC7KPq

.@Tim_Walz and @peggyflanagan have stood up for Minnesotans since day 1. This win is for all Minnesotans who want better healthcare, better schools and so much more. We are #OneMinnesota. https://t.co/3CKNFthJDS

Congratulations to @AngieCraigMN on her victory tonight! Angie has worked tirelessly on this campaign because she cares about the people she will represent. I enjoyed campaigning with her and Iook forward to working with her in Congress.

A big win in CD-3! @deanbphillips has driven his government repair truck all around the district and now he’s heading to Washington DC! It was an honor to campaign with him this year. Congratulations, Dean!
Congratulations to @MNSteveSimon, @KeithEllison, and @JulieBlaha on your wins! I look forward to working with you.
DFLers win the majority in the Minnesota House of Representatives!  A huge win for our state. Congratulations to our new Speaker, @melissahortman!

Our family’s never before been portrayed in LEGOs....but it is a morning for new beginnings!  Thanks Will and thank your son. My husband will especially enjoy that shock of blonde hair he gave him. https://t.co/5NfKWgSvpc

Historic outcome in Minnesota last night: half our federal delegation is now women w/victories for @TinaSmithMN @BettyMcCollum04 @AngieCraigMN & @IlhanMN . We’ve come a long way since U.S. Rep Coya Knutson lost to 6’4” Odin Langen whose slogan was “A big man for a man-sized job.”

Now that the President has made Jeff Sessions resign, it is more important than ever that the Special Counsel investigation continue. This happened the day after the mid-terms for one reason—he didn’t want the American people to hold him accountable. No one is above the law.

Thinking of Justice Ginsburg today. She’s a woman of incredible strength and I have no doubt that that same strength will carry her through her recovery. Here’s one of our daughter’s favorite photos (Abigail, me and “Notorious RBG”) https://t.co/zgVvW8h3z5

Acting AG’s statements on investigation mean he shouldn’t run it or be AG. Republicans who have claimed they don’t want to interfere w/investigation must lead & work w/us to protect rule of law: Senate & House must move now to protect Mueller investigation https://t.co/Z4a7hhRkG7

“AG” Whitaker’s 2014 words when asked about worse SCOTUS cases: “There are so many..I would start with the idea of Marbury v. Madison..and the Supreme Court as the final arbiter..We’ll move forward from there—All New Deal cases that were expansive of the federal government...”😱

We know a little something about recounts in MN. Every vote must be counted (and now recounted because it is so close) in Florida. Every vote. That’s how democracy works. And see this: In Arizona race, Dem takes lead over Republican as vote count continues https://t.co/6dapAXGMY9

This isn’t a headline anyone should read. Surviving two of our nation’s deadly shootings? It doesn’t have to be. The vast majority of Americans (and hunters) agree: common sense gun legislation must become the law of the land. Ask your rep why it isn’t. 
https://t.co/zjRIKQKPov

We need to pass my Secure Elections Act, which would help states update their outdated election systems, require audits, and guarantee that states using federal election $ have a paper trail for every ballot - something we don’t have right now in Georgia & parts of Florida.

A reminder of how precious life is, how much our friends in California are suffering this weekend in the midst of multiple fires, and what being a parent is all about: Watch a Father Calm His Daughter As They Drive Out Of Wildfire Range | N... https://t.co/xg6I1NqGYE via @YouTube

It was an honor to spend today with Park High School’s Air Force Junior Reserve Officer Training Corps, especially with just a few days until Veterans Day. It’s inspiring to see so many young people answering the call to serve. Thank you for having me. https://t.co/fAY4hkTX0S

Big doubts emerging on “acting A.G.” Whitaker. Legality of appointment, past business deals, questioning Marbury vs. Madison etc etc. Through it all we must uphold the independence of the Mueller investigation and thus the rule of law.

Thanks to our incredible campaign staff & volunteers who reminded everyone that there’s still fun in politics! We won big but did it with joy & purpose, helping a lot of others along the way. If you helped but aren’t in these photos, you are there in spirit. Thanks everyone! https://t.co/EjcY3pgSUV

Jeb, between us & everyone else, you’ve sadly identified the very reason my hot dish entry came up short: good name, bad soup. The curly fried ode to our Olympic gold 🥌team just didn’t make up for the recipe’s excess 🍜 soup.Try my 1st prize taconite tater tot recipe, circa 2010 https://t.co/rTVgPyfp3O

Congratulations to Gophers Women’s Basketball coach Lindsay Whalen @Lindsay_13 on the winning game and for breaking the attendance record! Congrats to the team as well. And they’re just getting started! 🏀 https://t.co/a6PIXobYoW

Happy Veteran’s Day to all those who serve & families. An honor to take part in the 100th Vet’s Day ceremony today for our MN vets in Inver Grove Heights. On the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month we tolled the bell 11 times. Thanks to those who have sacrificed for us.

Honored to spend Veterans Day at the annual MN State Veterans Day ceremony in Inver Grove Heights. Thank you for your service. And thanks to General Shellito for his many years of service, including heading of the MN National Guard and his work as State Commissioner for MN vets. https://t.co/mZxxl7LjOb

Way to go Minnesota! Because of everyone’s involvement, we saw 64% of eligible MN voters turn out to vote this past Tuesday. That’s the highest percentage of voters in a midterm in our history! Thanks to @MNSteveSimon for keeping us at the top. https://t.co/sbH7DAp51d

The cost of Rx drugs continues to skyrocket and put strain on patients. The President says he wants to lower prices -- here's one way to do just that: support my bill with @ChuckGrassley to limit anticompetitive “pay-for-delay” pharmaceutical settlements!

Many retailers are honoring veterans’ service to our country by extending deals to veterans and their families today as well as yesterday. Here’s a look at a few places:
https://t.co/Pc8fUMSkb0

This has been a week of tragedy in California. As sadly noted below, “Paradise is gone.” We must do everything we can to help rebuild & take real steps to prevent fires like this from happening, including serious national action to combat climate change.
https://t.co/SF2TPLC2Tc

Justice Page is not only a former Minnesota @Vikings and Minnesota Supreme Court Justice, but a dedicated public servant whose organization has helped students of color get college scholarships for years. Congratulations!
https://t.co/YU6v7Lmn6R

Another reason to pass my Secure Elections Act? Here’s what a GOP county chair in FL told CNN: "The machinery is old. They don't have enough updated machinery to go through all the ballots to run one election, let alone all three statewide races."
https://t.co/VOwvXQAeds

Visited the Rochester Int’l Airport to see upgrades from federal grant. Rochester is a vibrant & growing city. Making this airport more accessible will continue that growth & bring more visitors to MN, Mayo, area schools, businesses & tourist spots.
https://t.co/AOmRGsk3gr
The race has been called in Arizona!  Welcome to the U.S. Senate, @kyrstensinema! Congratulations on becoming the first woman Senator elected from your state.  Looking forward to working together.
An important opportunity that shouldn’t be lost...federal sentencing reform has broad support: Bipartisan Sentencing Overhaul Moves Forward, but Rests on Trump    https://t.co/IJy4WOgMlj

Why isn’t the Administration pledging to fight cybercrime and election inference? We should be doing everything we can to secure our democracy.
https://t.co/eeiYPPRp2z
We can’t leave rural America behind when our farmers and ranchers and towns are facing real economic uncertainty. We should work to get the #FarmBill passed before the end of the year.

Our Constitution doesn’t say “we the party” -- it begins with the powerful words “we the people." When it comes to our elections that means counting every vote. Period. As Florida undergoes a major recount we must make sure the people's voice is heard.

At least 48 people have now perished in the California fires, with many more feared dead. So many have lost their homes and businesses. If you’re looking for ways to help, here are some options. https://t.co/uC9MjVuOuM

There are now 80 confirmed cases of AFM (a rare, polio-like disease) in children in the U.S., 7 of which are in MN. I have continued to press the CDC for treatment options and research. We must help the families impacted by this horrible disease get answers.
Thanks Erik.  Didn’t know about this and thanks for sharing.  I will let my dad know. We can’t lose Zups!  Loved this Ely boy’s ode to Zups sausages. https://t.co/dnfIZRPOsR

We can’t stay silent when it comes to the Admin revoking press credentials — a free press & the 1st amendment is at the core of our democracy. Media outlets are joining CNN and supporting their lawsuit to allow access to the president:
https://t.co/w3x0jba9oe

This is a bipartisan effort to preserve the integrity of the Mueller investigation. This is not about politics. Republican leadership needs to work with us to ensure that the Special Counsel investigation can continue. https://t.co/yonnWiAUaP
Even if we set aside the legality of his questionable appointment, acting “AG” Whitaker has called the Mueller investigation “ridiculous.” He can’t be in charge of it. https://t.co/fzy0phynAI

Sad to hear that we’ve lost Richard Proudfit, the founder of Minnesota-based Feed My Starving Children @fmsc_org. He leaves a legacy of billions of meals delivered to malnourished children all around the world. He will be missed. https://t.co/a0D5iMKVBr

Was great to be w/ @TheRevAl & @NationalAction community leaders. Thanks for having me speak on the importance of counting every vote so everyone's voice is heard and on how we move forward on big issues that will help all American families. #NANLPC18 https://t.co/XHlCLtXWG5

Good news: federal loans I’ve worked for to make much-needed improvements to Northern MN’s electric grid have been approved. These infrastructure upgrades will improve the power grid, provide jobs and strengthen the economy for Minnesotans. https://t.co/itSJITTC6c
Breaking news: Florida senate race heads to a manual recount!  #CountEveryVote
We sent an important letter to DOJ today on Facebook following reports that they had hired an outside contractor to research and spread info on critics. https://t.co/x9myGG46w9

Will be there today when Alan Page receives the Medalof Freedom.  Saw him & his family last night & they couldn’t be prouder. He broke barriers: in the NFL, in law school, and on the MN Supreme Court: Alan Page:It is an honor, but it's not really about me. https://t.co/gKVFlGaqyb
A wonderful Medal of Honor award at the White House for my friend Alan Page (here with his son Justin) and Justice Kagan too! https://t.co/ET8EcPTqpO

Thanks Nicki! “Nevertheless We Persisted” is an amazing collection of short essays by people who have overcome great obstacles and emerged stronger. It was an honor to be asked to do the Foreword. Lesson? The obstacles on the path aren’t always obstacles; they are the path. https://t.co/8AExQMMHLJ

To @StaceyAbrams & everyone pushing to make all voices heard in our democracy, thank you. You and your Georgia team are extraordinary.  More to come I know!  Many chapters ahead for you....
RT: https://t.co/2nWsxhYEgV

“Mr. Cotton (perhaps loudest critic of sentencing changes) urged colleagues to slow down, saying that the bill’s implications were too expansive to push through without hearings” REALLY? We’ve had multiple hearings.  Time for action. Pass #FirstStepAct   https://t.co/kzZ9nyBfRR
Our courts shouldn’t have to do this. The credentials shouldn’t have been taken away in the first place. The freedom of the press is critical to our democracy. https://t.co/eoQMxqd061

We’ve secured over $46 million in additional funding for MinnesotaCare, MN’s basic healthcare program I’ve long advocated for. This is an important step forward for affordable, comprehensive coverage for many Minnesotans.

One day each year, @GiveMN encourages Minnesotans to donate to their favorite charity in a statewide effort to raise as much money as possible for nonprofits. On Thursday, Minnesotans set a record of $21.06 million! Way to go! https://t.co/IV2yLzkktl

As author of Honest Ads Act, need answers re @nytimes reports that Facebook hired partisan firm to spread negative info about its critics (including electeds) to press & online. This is modern-day internet equivalent of hiring thugs to take down your enemies. Pass Honest Ads Act!
